notes.text:
A patch is now available for Red Hat Fuse 7.6 on EAP. The purpose of this text-only errata is to inform you about the security issue fixed in this release.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This is an asynchronous patch for Red Hat Fuse 7.6.0 on EAP, and includes the following security fix:

* commons-beanutils: apache-commons-beanutils: does not suppresses the class property in PropertyUtilsBean by default (CVE-2019-10086)

To completely fix this CVE, EAP 7.2.7 or later must be applied to the system in addition to this Fuse on EAP patch. 

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

product.name: Red Hat Fuse 7.6.0 on EAP async
product.product_id: Red Hat Fuse 7.6.0 on EAP async

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Apache Commons BeanUtils, where the class property in PropertyUtilsBean is not suppressed by default. This flaw allows an attacker to access the classloader.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: apache-commons-beanutils: does not suppresses the class property in PropertyUtilsBean by default
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

fixed: Red Hat Fuse 7.6.0 on EAP async

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

Installation instructions are available from the Fuse 7.6.0 product documentation page:
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_fuse/7.6/

Note that to completely fix this CVE, EAP 7.2.7 or later must be applied to the system in addition to this Fuse on EAP patch.
product_ids: Red Hat Fuse 7.6.0 on EAP async

remediations.details: There is no currently known mitigation for this flaw.
product_ids: Red Hat Fuse 7.6.0 on EAP async
